page.title: 10Cobdens, Abattoir Martock
page.content: The cows are bought from local farms and many cattle markets around the country. The cows are shot with a humane gun. Sheep are stunned with an electrolethaler. An average of 150 cows are killed per day compared with about 200-240 about 2-3 years ago. Years ago cows were skinned on the floor now they are skinned on an over head rail. 12 men are needed to fill all the places on the slaughtering line. The large lorries that take the hind quarters of beef and carry about 210 hinds. Sick or injured animals are slaughtered and inspected by council meat inspectors. if the meat is passed it is used for human consumption. If it is rejected it is used for pet food . When the firm first started the horses were the main kill. At the present only cattle and sheep are killed.
